Posts.Content: erinm216 wrote: I am three months exactly from my exchange surgery and am still in pain on the side that was cancerous.It constantly feels like I have been punched in the breast My PS says he's heard patients say this before and it could be that my implants are moving too much. I have to revisit him in three months ( ironically it will be my year anniversary from my Mx on my next appt) we may have to swap out the implants to a textured form. Did anyone experience pain this far out of exchange Did anyones implants ever ‘move’ It feels like this will never end somedays. Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2014 09:35AM erinm216 wrote: I hate to tell you this but I came to the board today to find out the same thing but I am 300 days out. For me, the true pain stopped about a month after the surgery.  The swelling is going down over the last few months. Now I am just uncomfortable in a way that I cant explain.  My PS said that he hears that all the time from women. It takes from 6months to a year to really settle down.  What I feel now is nerves I assume. It sucks though and I wish you some speedy healing

Posts.Title: Oncotype 12 now game plan changed erinm216 jklimek

Posts.Content: erinm216 wrote: Today I was scheduled to do my first round of chemo. Dr came in and said there's been some developments! Ut oh. I'm 45 and post menopausal - on a whim he ran the oncotype and the k(# something) and it came back as a 12. Little difference between Tamoxifin and Tamoxifin and chemo. He said the benefits of chemo are so low hell leave it up to me, he wouldn't lose sleep if I said no to chemo. How do I choose if its worth it? It looks like there's only8% chance of reoccurrence in 10 years for BOTH Tamoxifin and chemo or just Tamoxifin. It's the same!! The lines completely merge at that point. Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2013 12:43AM erinm216 wrote: Hi all, I have my second opinion tomorrow and I am so nervous I feel like crying.  I am 99% sure I am going to stick with the first MO and plan to start Chemo in two weeks. It amazes me how I can be so put together somedays and others I just can't deal. I have made arrangments for a short hair cut and to get a wig, I have also signed up for the Look Good Feel Better seminar and go to that next week. Now I am focused on gaining weight.  I am so scared to be fat and bald and it irriatates me that I am so vain. Anyhow, hoping everyone else who is beginning this Chemo trip is doing well today.
